text: it's actually impressive that planes can fly without an engine.  if I remember correctly, the Airbus A380 is certified to fly without two engines on the same wing

text: I've only flown once and it was among the most uncomfortable things I've ever done in my life. Granted my wife got sick for the entire flight both ways due to meds shes on... Either way if this happened, I'd probably just die or something.

attachments.title: United Airlines flight makes emergency landing after dropping debris
attachments.text: A United Airlines flight has made an emergency landing after suffering major damage to one of its engines and dropping huge pieces of debris over a neighborhood in Broomfield, Colorado.
attachments.fallback: Mail Online: United Airlines flight makes emergency landing after dropping debris

text:
A similar incident happened with a Boeing 747 above the Netherlands: <https://edition.cnn.com/2021/02/21/europe/cargo-plane-debris-meerssen-netherlands-trnd/index.html>
In this case, the debris caused not only material damage on the ground, but at least two people got injured by falling debris.

attachments.title: Cargo plane's engine catches fire, dropping debris that injures two people in a Dutch town
attachments.text: Two people were injured after pieces of a cargo plane broke off and fell onto a town in the Netherlands, according to authorities there.
attachments.fallback: CNN: Cargo plane's engine catches fire, dropping debris that injures two people in a Dutch town
